text: <@U1M7K67EV>:  you will have to probably wait until people from around  the world wake up, but you will get help eventually.
Thanks <@U1JB7QCBD> I'll be heading home soon so hopefully someone during my night will know how to fix it
I have determined that the files it needs are located in node_modules but when running the tests it doesn't seem to be looking in there
maybe you are not in the env it expects?

Question.  When chaincode returns error (i.e. failed for smartcontact agreement, it return "return nil, err", and at the same time Node SDK client listens transaction invoke via <transaction-context>('complete', function) and <transaction-context>('error', function), the error goes to <transaction-context>('error', function) process, right ?   Or does it go to 'complete' ? In latter case, I think I need to check if transaction has failed or somehow.
<@U1M7K67EV>: Your issue above should be fixed now.  There were some files not moved over from github to gerrit due to some problems with .gitignore file.
<@U11CP8FF1> Events from the peer back to the node SDK are yet implemented but are being worked on by @pmulley.  Once this is complete, you should get responses back with the ‘complete’ event
<@U1M7K67EV>: BTW, you can also use “npm install hfc” which includes all required files
Thanks <@U0S5KF44D> I'll be giving it another go soon
Doesn't seem to be working still. There is now a Jira issue for it: <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-98>
